alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Southern Jasper; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 1:58PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tyler and northern Hardin Counties through 230 PM CST... At 158 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Thicket, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodville, Kountze, Saratoga, Wildwood, Warren, Thicket, Caney Head, Votaw, Honey Island, Batson, Village Mills, Ivanhoe and Hillister. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Texas.
